title: Sidewall, 1815–30
medium: Block-printed on joined sheets of handmade paper
description: A set of pipes, a tambourine, and an arrow centered in a horizontal hexagon shape. Centered in a vertical hexagon shape below is a figure, probably Thyiades, one of Bacchus's female companions.  Figure wears a long, wavy robe while dancing and holding a cup.  Hexagon shapes and images printed in shades of gray and white on a two-toned blue background of floral and leaf motifs.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sidewall, 1815–30.
1815–30. Block-printed on joined sheets of handmade paper. Gift of Josephine Howell. 1972-42-222.
